Description:
Zoku Owarimonogatari (続・終物語) is the 11th Monogatari Series anime adaptation from Studio Shaft. It adapts the final novel of Final Season:  Zoku Owarimonogatari. It premiered with screenings in Japanese theaters on November 10, 2018, and later as 6-episode TV broadcast on May 18, 2019.[1][2] 
During the theatrical release, a new short story titled Sodachi Mirror (そだちミラー) was distributed to early moviegoers.[3] Another short story titled Ougi Reflect (おうぎリフレクト) is included in the second volume of the Blu-ray and DVD release.

#Trivia.text:
Zoku Owarimonogatari has marked the longest time gap between anime adaptation releases since Nisemonogatari. The finale of Bakemonogatari to the premiere of Nisemonogatari was about 18 months. The finale of Owarimonogatari to the premiere of Zoku Owarimonogatari was about 15 months. Most other gaps have been within less than a year.
This marks the first adaptation directed by Akiyuki Shinbo alone. Tomoyuki Itamura had already left Shaft as he was credited as a storyboard artist on the 2018 anime film I Want to Eat Your Pancreas[6].
